content:
I actually just changed this setting:
image.png

And it is less key strokes than a quick action would be e.g:

vscodevim

Box::new(
<esc>E
)

v.s

quick action

vE (to select text)
<Ctrl-.>
Scroll through select quick action
<enter>
Box::new
<enter>

My apologies I'll close this.
Jack Clayton has marked this topic as resolved.
@Jack Clayton note that you can also add custom postfix completions: https://rust-analyzer.github.io/manual.html#user-snippet-completions
box postfix for Box::newshould still be a builtin one even

Wow that's awesome @Laurențiu and @Lukas Wirth , for anyone else to access postfix snippets in VS Code just put a period after what you want to wrap and there are some presets like box which will wrap the variable in box::new().

So cool cheers.

Relatedly, I've found that postfix completions don't seem to work with the rust-lang/rust repo. As I type foo.match, nothing comes up, even though it works outside of rust-lang/rust. Maybe there are just so many suggested completions that it glitches out?
